The web portal of the National Forest Surveillance System (SNSF web portal) of the Democratic Republic of Congo (DRC) is a geospatial platform of the Ministry of Environment and Sustainable Development (MEDD), which simultaneously fulfills two functions: (1) Monitoring and (2) Measurement, Notification and Verification (MNV) of REDD+ activities.
The Monitoring function is implemented at the national level and makes it possible to assess a wide range of forest information, particularly that related to REDD+ activities and sustainable forest management. The MNV function relates to the estimation and international reporting of greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions and removals. The first function comprises three components which are: (i) the Satellite Land Monitoring System (SSTS); (ii) the Forest Inventory System (SIFN) and (iii) Community Surveillance. The MNV function is composed of: (i) SSTS; (ii) SIFN and (iii) the Greenhouse Gas Inventory (IGES). The information from the first two components (SSTS and IFN) is used to feed the information into the IGES component.
As part of its SSTS component, specific activities are implemented at the national level to monitor Major Deforestation Events (MDT) linked, among other things, to the extension of forest concessions and the development of large agro-industrial projects. and mining. This EMD information is also available on the portal.

Map data

The DRC SNSF brings together data from different sources, governmental and non-governmental. Government data is produced by the Ministry of Environment and Sustainable Development (MEDD); non-governmental data are produced by the technical partners (eg OSFAC, WWF, WRI, JICA / JAFTA etc.) of the ministry (MEDD). These data are used as decision support tools in connection with REDD + and more generally to define the forest policies of the DRC.
